reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: This is the Partner cooperative agreement in Kenya. Funds are used to support staff salaries and benefits, program monitoring expenses, office and vehicle expenses, an annual audit, training, and other small administrative expenses. Funds disbursed to provide liquidity in light of unanticipated shocks impacting project activities and grantee enterprises due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Funds to assist with project needs in light of fund shortage due to COVID-19.. Sector:Water and sanitation Beneficiaries: Marginalized slum dwellers, mostly women Summary: Support from the U.S. African Development Foundation of $150,000 will enable SHOFCO to construct and operate three clean water kiosks, connected by aerial piping, for one year. In addition to covering all costs encompassed in the project construction, this commitment will provide clean water to over 12,000 individuals in Kibera.. Sector:Water and sanitation Beneficiaries: 13,810 Marginalized slum dwellers, mostly women Summary: Support from the U.S. African Development Foundation of $101,873 will enable SHOFCO to construct and operate three clean water kiosks, connected by aerial piping, for one year. In addition to covering all costs encompassed in the project construction, this commitment will provide clean water to over 12,000 individuals in Kibera.. Sector:Water and sanitation Beneficiaries: Marginalized slum dwellers, mostly women Summary: Support from the U.S. African Development Foundation of $101,873 will enable SHOFCO to construct and operate three clean water kiosks, connected by aerial piping,. Sector:Water and sanitation Beneficiaries: Marginalized slum dwellers, mostly women Summary: Support from the U.S. African Development Foundation of $101,873 will enable SHOFCO to construct and operate three clean water kiosks, connected by aerial piping, for one year. In addition to covering all costs encompassed in the project construction, this commitment will provide clean water to over 12,000 individuals in Kibera.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I Street NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005-2248

description.narrative: In the last few years, Kenya has embarked on a comprehensive and ambitious democratic reform process, including the devolution of government structures and authorities. The goal of devolution is to facilitate a more accountable and participatory system of governance that will allow for broader-based economic growth and improved service delivery at the local level. U.S. assistance in Kenya works across sectors to support this process with an overarching goal of sustainably strengthening regional peace, prosperity and security. These sectors include democracy, human rights and governance; elections in 2017; health including quality and accessibility, infectious diseases, child and maternal health, and water and sanitation; agriculture; private sector competitiveness; education and youth; and environment including biodiversity, adaptation for climate change and combating wildlife trafficking. In addition to participating in several Presidential Initiatives, Kenya is a Relief-to-Development Transition (R2DT) Focus Country and receives assistance to promote resilience and climate adaptation in drought-prone areas.

sector.narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
